column4: ok I really appreciate the help, I made the changes ill reboot 2 see
you need to make it look like this: http://samba.osmirror.nl/samba/ftp/samba-3.4.0.tar.gz
you need to make it look like this: http://pastebin.com/m3d9652d6
no need to reboot, just sudo umount -a
then sudo mount -a
Oh you are testing auto mounting aren't you... maybe reboot then :)
i did the umount and mount and I'm getting "mount point /media/raid5i does not exist, will it still work upon reboot?
you need to make a driectory in /media with that name... ie: sudo mkdir /media/raid5i
then try the umount -a and mount -a again
that did it!!!!!!
awesome
tyvm
may I suggest you use UUID instead of the /dev/sdb1
sure, do i just replace "/dev/sdb1" with "UUID" ?
no you need to find the UUID of /dev/sdb1... One second I gotta look it up
ls /dev/disk/by-uuid
and "blkid" to see what drive the UUID refers to
ill do that now, out of curiosity why is that better practice then using the /dev/sdb1 ?
yes, you can change the location of the drive inside the computer and it all still works
that is you can change /dev/sdb1 to /devsdc1 and it will still work
alrighty I'll do that, everyone ive talked to in the ubuntu channel has been extremely helpful us noobs appreciate that :P
that is why we are here. We all started out as noobs once :)
